title: Christian Pulisic 'considering Chelsea future' after lack of opportunities under Frank Lampard
text:

Christian Pulisic is reportedly considering his Chelsea future just months after he completed his move to the club.

The attacking midfielder has been an unused substitute in the previous three Premier League games against Wolves , Liverpool and Brighton before not making the squad for the win over Lille in the Champions League.

The 21-year-old faces a stiff competition for places in the starting line-up with the likes of Pedro, Willian, Mason Mount, newly back Callum Hudson-Odoi, Ross Barkley and Rueben Loftus-Cheek when he returns from injury.

Pulisic began the season well with an assist in the Super Cup defeat to Liverpool in August before managing his another two assists in the win over Norwich and Grimsby in the Carabao Cup.

(Image: Getty Images)

And, according to the Daily Mail , Pulisic has 'admitted' his frustration for being overlooked by Frank Lampard but wants to fight for his place at the Blues.

The Chelsea boss has picked experience and English youth over Pulisic in matchday squads recently, with Willian, Pedro, Mount and Hudson-Odoi all seeing plenty of minutes on the pitch.

But, the US international is understood to want to fight for his place under the Blues legend and consider his options if he doesn't feel like he has been given a chance to prove his ability.

(Image: Chelsea FC via Getty Images)

However, Lampard has urged the new signing to work for his place and warned his price tag doesn't guarantee a starting birth.

“I spoke to Christian two days before the Grimsby game and was very clear about the standards. And we have to give him the fact he has moved country, leagues and is as young as all the young ­players we are talking about.

“He has just turned 21. So if anyone is getting too ­excited about this, they should calm down, frankly, ­because he has ­already started five games for us.

“What he needs to do is work daily, and work to show within the group that he ­deserves to play – as all the players do."

Pulisic joined the club in a £58million move from B in January before being loaned back to Borussia Dortmund for the remainder of last season.

The American was confirmed as a Chelsea player over the summer and joined up with his new teammates ahead of their pre-season tour.

Chelsea face Southampton on Sunday as they look to continue their three game win streak.
description: American attacking midfielder has been frustrated with his lack of game time this season
